alert.note: Alert for Ford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 2:27PM CDT until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and east central Illinois, including the following areas, in central Illinois, Livingston. In east central Illinois, Ford. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 225 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - These storms are expected to continue to produce rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches per hour as they move through the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pontiac, Fairbury, Gibson City, Chatsworth, Forrest, Melvin, Elliott, Sibley and Strawn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
